body.name: Microwave Ramen Cooker,Ramen Bowl With Chopsticks and Spoon,For Office College Dorm Room Essentials Instant Lunch Ideal for Shin and Buldak Ramen Noodle On The Go, Dishwasher-Safe,BPA-Free. (gray)

features: 【EASY OPERATION】The ramen cooker bowl with a heat-resistant side handle can be removed from your microwave easily and safe to avoid scalding your hands. It can help you save much time in cooking ramen noodles. It’s an essential for college student dorm rooms or busy adults with hungry kids.

【ECO-FRIENDLY】The ramen cooker bowl is made from wheat straw (natural organic composite) and food-grade PP. Unlike some other containers or accessories, this lightweight rapid ramen cooker is portable and easy to store. It’s BPA free, gluten-free, non-toxic, odorless and eco-friendly. Never use it in BBQ and convection mode.
【CREATIVE DESIGN】The side handle of the bowl can be used as a phone stand/holder. You can place your cell phone against it. It’s so joyful to follow TV series while eating noodles.

【HOW TO USE】The soup bowl and the drain basket can be used to soak noodles, then heat up and filter water. The smallest bowl in the top is also the bowl cover. After noodles are cooked, take it out from the microwave. Pick draining basket up and filter water. Pour noodles into the small bowl, then mix with different delicious sauces according to your preference. P.S. Instant noodles can be cooked by adding boiling water.
【SERVICE】If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: RORBAM Ramen Cooker Bowl, For students in college dorm and busy adults, it’s a wonderful cooking utensil to enjoy delicious noodles, spaghetti, cereal, etc. The ramen bowl consists of a big bowl, a small bowl, a drain basket, a spoon, a fork and a pair of chopsticks, in order to meet your daily needs.Cell phone can be placed against the side handle, making you enjoy tasty food without missing wonderful TV programs.Lightweight, anti-sliding, sturdy. Don’t worry about broken when falling down.Food-grade material, BPA free.
Holder for fork and spoon Holder for fork and spoon Chopsticks holder Drain basket, easy to separate the soup and noodles

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly I haven't even used the bowl
reviews.reviewText: Compact, light, easy to clean, not messy at all, it's very cute, only cooks one pack of ramen per use which is fine for me honestly. It's a perfect tool if you're short on time or have nothing else to cook with other than a microwave.I wouldn't recommend leaving it in the microwave for more than 5 minutes honestly, I usually microwave it for 3-4 minutes and let the food sit with the bowl on top for about a minute before trying to eat it. Any ingredients I add are either pre-cut or pre-cooked ahead of time, either over the weekend or early in the morning so that they just get heat up inside the bowl when I microwave them together.It's not super travel friendly if there's food being kept inside of it since there's no lid that locks into place so you can risk spilling food if you're bringing it with you to work or school. I'd recommend having any other ingredients pre-cooked and put inside other secure containers if you want to travel with it instead. That way you can just throw everything in and stick it in the microwave when it's time to eat.It comes with a bowl but I haven't put food in it because it's kind of small, I just eat straight out of the pot and strainer because I'm too lazy to rearrange the food after its been cooked. The utensils are short and cute, but might be a little difficult to use if you're not used to them, and they don't really fit into the rest of the product anywhere so they're difficult to carry around with you if you're bringing them with you to work. But it CAN fit pretty easily into a lunchbox...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute! Works well, though no easy way to bring the utensils along.
reviews.reviewText: It's adorable!I used a ramen for this that had long straight dried noodles that wouldn't fit in the basket as is - so I broke them in half and went from there. Filled water up to the 'ridge' on the inside and microwaved for 4 minutes. The ramen I used is also not exactly designed to be microwaved - but that's also entirely why I wanted to try that specific one.Anyway - 4 minutes left perfectly normal noodles and hot water. I added in my flavoring and I like my noodles a little softer - so popped it back in for another 30 seconds.Like others, I did not use the bowl. The amount of water I added and noodles - I honestly don't think it'd FIT. (But I could have added too MUCH water.) But it did make a nice cover, so I could pop the bowl on top to help it stay hot if I had to walk away for a second (which is exactly what I'm doing as I type this)I didn't particularly see the point of the draining basket if using this for ramen - but just found a fantastic use. Raising it up to get all the noodles that stay at the bottom and are hard to find! Haha!I did use both the chopsticks and the fork. I feel the Chopsticks might be a bit short, so maybe not suited for larger hands. The fork is just a fork.Very nice overall! I've been hankering ramen at work but didn't have any way to cook noodles. I just found my new favorite work container :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The handle is a bit too small and flimsy
reviews.reviewText: The handle is too small and flimsy to pick up the pot out of the microwave without possibly burning your hand. It will flex when hot and let the back of your fingers push against the pot portion when it is full of hot water.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Ramen Bowl
reviews.reviewText: Used it for the first time tonight and just bought a second one! It was so simple to use! I have porcelain bowls for noodle dishes so really just used the bowl as a top for the pot. As others have noted, 3-4 minutes cook time and a minute to sit covered is all it takes for a perfect ramen bowl. I added pre cooked chicken while the noodles were cooking and put all sauces and chives in the porcelain bowl. When the ramen and chicken were ready I simply added to the bowl, stirred and it was really to eat. Having a second one will work perfect for us! We'll be able to prepare one bowl while the other is cooking. We're really excited to explore other noodle dishes in this little cooker!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got this for myself at work and let me tell you, it has been a game changer for my lunchtime. I can now easily make ramen noodles and even poach an egg (by cracking it on top of the noodles) and I don’t have to worry about it making a mess in the microwave. The smaller bowl creates a lid and keeps everything together. I can also strain the noodles when I don’t want a brothy ramen. I also use the bowl to heat up other foods as well. It’s just super handy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The boys love this
reviews.reviewText: My boys love ramen. Now they especially like making their own with these bowls. I'll probably order a few more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Tiny & cheap quality
reviews.reviewText: The bowl photo used in their Amazon listing is deceptively larger than in reality. A single ramen package fits the bowl. The utensils as tiny & very flimsy. Buyer beware: don’t waste your money on this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size for Nongshim Shin Ramyun pouch ramen
reviews.reviewText: Exactly the right size to microwave Nong Shim ramyun noodle packs. Works better than the Sistema soup bowl I'd been using previously. Includes a straining insert which is handy if you need to drain the noodles before mixing in a stir-fry sauce (as is the case with most Samyang, Ottogi and Paldo ramen/ramyun). The lid doubles as a small soup bowl. The set includes a dual-purpose fork/knife, a spoon and chopsticks made from durable plastic. The bowls are dishwasher-safe; I would hand-wash the utensils, however.Recommended if you're a ramen/ramyun fiend like me.
